sources.title: Lists of languages
sources.progress: indexed via catalog_wikipedia_languages.py; needs continual refresh
sources.notes: Primary entry point for harvesting Wikipedia's grouped language, dialect, and accent lists. Drives the cached docs/wikipedia_language_index.* outputs that seed NVDA's tiered selector.

sources.title: List of ISO 639 language codes
sources.notes: Master table that links historic and modern ISO 639 identifiers; anchors phoneme profiles to authoritative code pairs for NVDA configuration exports.

sources.title: List of ISO 639-2 codes
sources.notes: Differentiates bibliographic (B) and terminologic (T) macrolanguage groupings required for backwards compatible voice template packaging.

sources.title: ISO 639 macrolanguage
sources.notes: Explains how multiple dialects and closely related languages collapse into a single ISO 639-3 code; informs dialect menu roll-ups.

sources.title: List of ISO 639-3 codes
sources.notes: Provides per-language scope (individual, macrolanguage, special) and type (living, extinct, historical) indicators for Eloquence voice catalog metadata.

sources.title: ISO 15924
sources.notes: Maps writing systems to four-letter codes; required for script-aware phoneme seed bundles and braille/export planning.

sources.title: List of scripts with no ISO 15924 code
sources.notes: Highlights gaps in ISO 15924 coverage so the phoneme customizer can stage provisional script identifiers and placeholder glyph datasets.

sources.title: ISO 15924: List of codes
sources.notes: Contains the canonical numeric and alphabetic script codes plus sample eras; feeds phoneme EQ defaults for script-specific consonant/vowel ranges.

sources.title: ConScript Unicode Registry
sources.notes: Documents community-maintained encoded scripts that inform fallback phoneme mappings when ISO standards do not exist.

sources.title: Medieval Unicode Font Initiative
sources.notes: Supplies historical glyph variants necessary for contextual phoneme shaping in medieval language templates.

sources.title: ISO 639-5
sources.notes: Defines alpha-3 codes for language families; sets up parent-level selectors and informs NVDA's mutually intelligible groupings.

sources.title: ISO 639-6
sources.notes: Captures dialect-level refinements formerly maintained in the 639-6 registry; helpful for accent-specific presets.

sources.title: List of ISO 639-6 codes
sources.notes: Archived table of ISO 639-6 identifiers that can seed dialect and accent menus where modern registries lack detail.

sources.title: Language family
sources.notes: Explains classification theory and relationships; guides the structuring of Eloquence's family-level overviews and documentation.

sources.title: IETF language tag
sources.notes: Details BCP 47 tags needed for NVDA configuration exports and bridging ISO codes with regional subtags (script, region, variant).

sources.title: Codes for constructed languages
sources.notes: Outlines how Esperanto, Interlingua, and other constructed languages receive standardized codes for packaging.

sources.title: Flag icons for languages
sources.notes: Offers accessible iconography references for NVDA dialogs while emphasising cultural sensitivity.

sources.title: Index of language articles
sources.notes: Master index for targeted research topics such as phonology, orthography, and sociolinguistics that influence phoneme EQ presets.

sources.title: List of lesser-known Loloish languages
sources.notes: Informs expansion of Sino-Tibetan coverage and highlights endangered dialects requiring urgent phoneme seeding.

sources.title: Hani languages
sources.notes: Details Hani/Miao-Yao dialect chains which align to phoneme contour variations documented in Loloish research.

sources.title: Taloid languages
sources.notes: Provides lexical comparison data for fine-tuning high-frequency consonant bands within Taloid dialect presets.

sources.title: Talodi–Heiban languages
sources.notes: Supports inclusion of Niger–Congo branches within African language packs.

sources.title: Yupik languages
sources.notes: Includes orthography and phoneme descriptions essential for polysynthetic language modelling.

sources.title: List of programming languages
sources.notes: Feeds pronunciation dictionaries for code reading modes; intersects with NVDA's developer audiences.

sources.title: List of BASIC dialects
sources.notes: Helps define accent/intonation cues for retro computing voices and developer-centric presets.

sources.title: List of constructed languages – Languages used in fiction
sources.notes: Guides fan-driven phoneme templates and ensures NVDA can surface fictional language presets with consistent metadata.

sources.title: List of official languages by country and territory
sources.notes: Supports priority planning for official support tiers and packaging by jurisdiction.

sources.title: List of countries by number of languages
sources.notes: Highlights multilingual hotspots to prioritise for phoneme and accent data collection.

sources.title: Lists of countries and territories by official language
sources.notes: Refines packaging needs for regional NVDA builds and cross-checks official statuses.

sources.title: Linguistic diversity index
sources.notes: Quantifies coverage gaps to measure Eloquence expansion impact regionally.

sources.title: List of language names
sources.notes: Assists with accessible naming and NVDA speech label localisation.

sources.title: Lists of extinct languages
sources.notes: Guides archival phoneme modelling and documentation of revived pronunciation efforts.

sources.title: List of language families
sources.notes: Provides enumerations of families for macro documentation and NVDA selector grouping.

sources.title: List of proposed language families
sources.notes: Tracks speculative relationships useful for research roadmaps and future-proofing dialect clustering.

sources.title: Extinct language
sources.notes: Offers guidance on documenting pronunciation evidence for languages without living speakers.

sources.title: Intercontinental Dictionary Series
sources.notes: Provides comparative lexicon samples necessary for cross-language phoneme and prosody tuning.

sources.title: International auxiliary language
sources.notes: Frames prioritisation for widely used constructed languages in accessibility contexts.

sources.title: Universal language
sources.notes: Historical background for universal speech projects; informs documentation narrative.

sources.title: Language isolate
sources.notes: Ensures isolates receive bespoke phoneme templates without incorrect family assignments.

sources.title: Unclassified language
sources.notes: Highlights research gaps for languages lacking classification; informs placeholder metadata.

sources.title: List of unclassified languages according to the Ethnologue
sources.notes: Adds Ethnologue perspective to unclassified languages, guiding outreach for phoneme data.

sources.title: Afroasiatic languages
sources.notes: Sets expectations for Semitic, Berber, Cushitic, Omotic, and Chadic coverage.

sources.title: List of Austronesian languages
sources.notes: Supports Pacific and Southeast Asian voice planning with sample lexical resources.

sources.title: List of Indo-European languages
sources.notes: Major coverage area for Eloquence; cross-links to existing NV Speech Player templates.

sources.title: List of Mayan languages
sources.notes: Provides glottalised consonant inventories needed for phoneme EQ presets.

sources.title: List of Mongolic languages
sources.notes: Informs vowel harmony parameter defaults for Mongolic voices.

sources.title: List of Oto-Manguean languages
sources.notes: Essential for building tonal contour presets for Mesoamerican languages.

sources.title: Tungusic languages: Classification
sources.notes: Guides template design for Siberian dialect clusters.

sources.title: List of Turkic languages
sources.notes: Supports vowel harmony and palatalization parameter sets.

sources.title: List of Uralic languages
sources.notes: Captures agglutinative morphology considerations for NVDA voice phrasing.

sources.title: List of languages by first written account
sources.notes: Contextualises script evolution timelines for historical voice packs.

sources.title: Undeciphered writing systems
sources.notes: Flags scripts that require placeholder phoneme strategies and research disclaimers.

sources.title: List of languages by total number of speakers
sources.notes: Guides prioritisation for voice and phoneme expansion.

sources.title: List of dictionaries by number of words
sources.notes: Identifies corpora suitable for training phoneme and prosody models.

sources.title: List of languages by number of phonemes
sources.notes: Directly informs EQ band planning and slider ranges for clarity vs. smoothness.

sources.title: Languages of Africa
sources.notes: Contextualises coverage targets for African voice bundles and sample rate needs for tonal languages.

sources.title: Indigenous languages of the Americas
sources.notes: Frames documentation for North, Central, and South American indigenous languages.

sources.title: List of Native American languages acquired by children
sources.notes: Identifies living acquisition contexts for tailoring phoneme instruction resources.

sources.title: Languages of North America
sources.notes: Feeds NVDA packaging notes for North American locales.

sources.title: Languages of South America
sources.notes: Highlights hotspots for phoneme diversity in Amazonian and Andean regions.

sources.title: Languages of Asia
sources.notes: Frames coverage for South, Southeast, East, and Central Asian phoneme templates.

sources.title: East Asian languages
sources.notes: Focuses on Sino-Tibetan, Japonic, Koreanic, and neighboring families for tonal and pitch-accent modelling.

sources.title: Languages of South Asia
sources.notes: Highlights Indo-Aryan and Dravidian interplay for phoneme contour planning.

sources.title: Classification of Southeast Asian languages
sources.notes: Summarises Mainland vs Maritime Southeast Asian typologies for voice presets.

sources.title: Languages of Europe
sources.notes: Coordinates coverage of Indo-European, Uralic, and minority languages for European NVDA builds.

sources.title: Languages of Russia
sources.notes: Critical for covering Russia's diverse linguistic landscape and script usage.

sources.title: Languages of Oceania
sources.notes: Combines Austronesian and Papuan coverage needs for Pacific voice bundles.

sources.title: List of languages by time of extinction
sources.notes: Useful for planning archival voice packs and resurrected phoneme datasets.

sources.title: Lists of endangered languages
sources.notes: Prioritises languages that need urgent preservation in Eloquence.

sources.title: List of revived languages
sources.notes: Shows where community documentation already exists to seed phoneme templates.

sources.title: Regional language
sources.notes: Helps align NVDA packaging with legal definitions of regional languages.

sources.title: List of lingua francas
sources.notes: Identifies languages needing robust accent coverage for cross-community communication.

sources.title: International English
sources.notes: Supports NVDA's global English presets spanning neutral accent strategies.

sources.title: List of official languages
sources.notes: Companion dataset to country/territory lists for packaging planning.

sources.title: List of official languages of international organizations
sources.notes: Helps prioritise languages critical for NGO and intergovernmental accessibility.

sources.title: Languages used on the Internet
sources.notes: Supports planning for online text-to-speech coverage and phoneme bias corrections.

sources.title: Mutual intelligibility
sources.notes: Guides accent slider defaults and cross-dialect bundling for Eloquence.

sources.title: List of creole languages
sources.notes: Documents lexifier/substrate relationships vital for phoneme blending parameters.

sources.title: Mixed language examples
sources.notes: Supports modelling of blended phoneme sets and accent transitions.

sources.title: Indo-European based pidgins, creoles, mixed languages, and cants
sources.notes: Gives actionable lists for English/French/Spanish-based derivatives relevant to NVDA.

sources.title: List of English-based pidgins
sources.notes: Focuses English derivative coverage for accent slider presets.

sources.title: List of sign languages
sources.notes: Supports planning for signed language phoneme proxies and iconography integration.

sources.title: List of sign languages by number of native signers
sources.notes: Prioritises sign languages by community size for gesture-to-phoneme mapping.

sources.title: Category: Dialects by language
sources.notes: Helps automate discovery of per-language dialect pages for accent slider presets.

sources.title: List of writing systems
sources.notes: Enables crosswalk between scripts and NVDA phoneme templates.

sources.title: List of shorthand systems
sources.notes: Relevant for high-speed phoneme articulation and stenography-friendly presets.

sources.title: Category: Lists of computer languages
sources.notes: Broader index for programming and markup language pronunciation packs.

sources.title: Lists of programming languages
sources.notes: Ensures coverage for domain-specific languages and education-focused pronunciations.

sources.title: Ontology language classification
sources.notes: Supports knowledge graph integration and speech output for ontology editors.

sources.title: Modelling language types
sources.notes: Aligns phoneme articulation for UML, SysML, and related modelling vocabularies.

sources.title: List of markup languages
sources.notes: Captures HTML/XML variants for developer voice presets.

sources.title: Inuktitut language
sources.notes: Feeds ISO iu roadmap work with syllabics charts, mora timing research, and punctuation guidance for right-to-left syllable clusters.

sources.title: Cherokee language
sources.notes: Supports ISO chr pronunciation templates and DECtalk lexicon comparisons prior to NVDA braille export updates.

sources.title: Cherokee syllabary
sources.notes: Documents syllable blocks for CodeQL validation and NVDA braille table integration when packaging Cherokee presets.

sources.title: Greenlandic language
sources.notes: Guides ISO kl (Kalaallisut) tone curves, affix stacking, and NVDA punctuation defaults sourced from NV Access manuals.

sources.title: Denaʼina language
sources.notes: Aligns ISO tfn Athabaskan presets with DataJake lexical archives and NV Speech Player nasal balance sliders.

sources.title: Gwich'in language
sources.notes: Supports ISO gwi slider planning with tone marker metadata for NVDA braille and phoneme EQ exports.

sources.title: Omniglot
sources.notes: Secondary repository for script charts and pronunciation audio that can seed Eloquence phoneme datasets.
